problems.title: Calculate Loan EMI with Interest and Fees
problems.description:
Calculate Equated Monthly Installment (EMI) with complex interest calculation.

Formula: EMI = [P × R × (1+R)^N] / [(1+R)^N - 1]
Where:
- P = Principal (loan amount)
- R = Monthly interest rate (annual_rate / 12 / 100)
- N = Number of months

Additional factors:
- Processing fee: 1% of principal (one-time, added to first EMI)
- Late payment penalty: 5% of EMI if payment > 5 days late

Given: principal, annual_interest_rate, years, payment_delay_days

Print:
- Regular EMI amount (rounded to 2 decimal places)
- First EMI (including processing fee)
- Current month payment (with penalty if delayed)

Input Format:
First line: principal annual_rate years
Second line: payment_delay_days

Output Format:
Print three lines: regular_emi, first_emi, current_payment
problems.examples:
Sample Input
100000 12 2
0

Sample Output
4707.35
5707.35
4707.35

Sample Input
100000 12 2
10

Sample Output
4707.35
5707.35
4942.72

Explanation:
Calculate EMI using formula, add processing fee to first EMI, apply penalty if delay > 5 days.
hintsList: Calculate monthly rate R = annual_rate/12/100. Calculate EMI using formula. Add 1% processing fee to first EMI. If delay > 5, add 5% penalty to current payment.
